title: Commending the UN Working Group for People of African Descent
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  commending  the  UN Working Group for People of
African Descent upon the occasion of recognizing  the  many  accomplish-
ments and extraordinary works of New Yorkers of African descent

WHEREAS,  It is the sense of this Legislative Body to honor those endur-
ing organizations which devote their purposeful  energies  to  improving
the quality and dignity of life of those they serve, to preserving their
heritage, and to fostering pride among them; and
  WHEREAS,  Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its long-
standing traditions, this Legislative Body is justly  proud  to  commend
the  UN Working Group for People of African Descent upon the occasion of
recognizing the many accomplishments  and  extraordinary  works  of  New
Yorkers  of  African descent, with the theme "People of African Descent-
Recognition, Justice, and Development"; and
  WHEREAS, The United Nations has designated 2011 as  the  International
Year  for  People  of  African  Descent;  numerous  activities have been
planned throughout the year to observe and celebrate  the  contributions
of people of African descent to the United States; and
  WHEREAS,  The  Opening Ceremony was held Friday, December 10, 2010, at
the United Nations Headquarters; and
  WHEREAS, It is the custom of this Legislative Body,  representing  the
citizens  of  the State of New York, to pay tribute to the people of our
African American communities throughout this great Empire State who have
added to our Country's rich history and multi-ethnic heritage; and
  WHEREAS, Events which celebrate  diversity  and  peace  contribute  to
fulfilling  our  Nation's  great  legacy of equality and opportunity for
all, and do so profoundly enhance our shared commitment to  freedom  and
justice; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
commend the UN Working Group for People  of  African  Descent  upon  the
occasion of recognizing the many accomplishments and extraordinary works
of New Yorkers of African descent; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to the UN Working Group for People of African Descent.
